quest.name: Chance of Gales
journal:
Alpa needs your help with the latest additions to Castellum Velodyna.
※The difficulty of this quest will be synced to your current level.

The area around the castellum is home to many dangerous creatures. To give travelers somewhere to stay at night, J'olhmyn had proposed converting unused storerooms into lodgings. She suggests speaking with someone who has actually slept in one of the newly prepared rooms to find out if anything needs to be improved.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Although the merchant is grateful to have had somewhere to stay, he did not enjoy a good night's sleep. Bedding from Vira Nilya had been provided, but he did not know what to do with it and slept on the floor instead. When Alpa demonstrates the correct method of using the bedding by curling into a coil, it becomes clear that she has no knowledge whatsoever of the needs of their two-legged guests. While J'olhmyn accepts responsibility for Alpa's lack of preparedness, she admits to being far from an expert on inns herself. She recommends looking around Ala Ghiri for those with experience in the field of accommodation to work as an advisor.

Upon arriving in Ala Ghiri, it soon becomes clear that the residents are busy restoring their village since its liberation from imperial rule. Although no one there has the time to go to Castellum Velodyna and act as advisor, you learn of a man called Gales who once worked as an innkeeper in Goodblade before it was razed. Alpa is carrying out her own inquiries and would be glad to hear this promising information.
Alpa is pleased by the news of there being a candidate for the role of advisor. She and J'olhmyn proceed to Goodblade, where Gales is said to be wandering aimlessly.

Gales has hit upon hard times since the fall of Goodblade. He seems convinced that he is no longer of use to anyone, but Alpa persuades him to aid in her cause. Despite being hesitant at first, he accepts the offer and travels with her to the castellum.

Upon seeing the shoddy state of the castellum's sleeping quarters, Gales unexpectedly flies into a rage. Unperturbed by this sudden outburst, Alpa is filled with renewed enthusiasm and vows to do her utmost to carry out Gales's orders. His first instructions are to gather raw materials for building beds and a chocobo stable, which can be found in the wreckage of a nearby imperial base, according to J'olhmyn. She advises you to ride a marid and use its powerful forelegs to smash the scrap metal into pieces small enough to carry. Luckily, Dakshina the Gatekeepers' resident marid trainer has one ready and waiting.
Climbing atop the marid, you head for what remains of Castellum Corvi. The enormous beast should make short work of crushing the scrap left strewn about the area.
Now that you and the marid have finished your work, the Gatekeepers can carry the raw materials back to Castellum Velodyna. Gales and the others eagerly await your return.

Thanks to Gales's cooperation, the castellum's guest rooms and chocobo stable are finally complete. His tutelage has given Alpa a deeper understanding of the travelers and their needs, while Gales realizes that he still has much to learn about the Ananta. Having overcome numerous hurdles, Alpa moves ever closer to bringing her plans for Velodyna to fruition.
objectives: Search for potential advisors in Ala Ghiri.
Speak with Gales in Castellum Velodyna.
Use the marid's Trample ability on the warmachina wreckage in Castellum Corvi.
Speak with Gales in Castellum Velodyna.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “The First of Many.”

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Good to sssee you, Forename! You know, I'd say our work is progresssing quite nicely. There's still time left, but even if Mother were to arrive tomorrow, I think she'd be impresssed!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Isn't it a bit early to be saying that?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: The work needs to be finished before she comes back. We'd have a hard time convincing your mother with the place as it is now.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Of course, the castellum is no longer under threat of demolition, and the griffin statues are very nice. But it's still more or less the same as when we arrived.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: What about the old ssstorerooms we converted into overnight lodgings?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Yes, I was just getting to that. As you doubtless know from personal experience, Forename, this whole area is crawling with dangerous creatures, many of which are more active at night.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Adventurers and soldiers can hold their own against them, but merchants and returning refugees are easy targets. We'll be seeing a lot more of them now that the Garleans have withdrawn.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: That's why I suggested that we put down some beds in the old storerooms. I haven't actually had a look yet, but I'm sure Alpa took care of it. There are probably a few things that need improving, though.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: If we ask someone who's actually spent the night here, we can get their opinion.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: That visitor from Gridania who ssslept here should still be about. Why don't we ssstart with him?

dialogue.name: MERCHANT03038
dialogue.text: Can I help you?

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Having stayed overnight in our lodgings, would you say you ssslept well?

dialogue.name: MERCHANT03038
dialogue.text: I wasn't expecting to find anywhere to stay and I was full glad to be offered shelter. Otherwise, I'd have been traveling in the dark with only the beasts breathing down my neck to keep me warm!

dialogue.name: MERCHANT03038
dialogue.text: Having said that, I think it's a bit soon to be calling them “lodgings.” I would've appreciated something to lie on besides the floor.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: The floor? I heard that travelers preferred to sssleep in proper beds so I had some brought over from Vira Nilya.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT03038
dialogue.text: A bed? I didn't see anything like that.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Alpa? You did give them something to sleep on, didn't you?

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Of course I did! Maybe it would be quicker if I just showed you. Wait here.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: You had one of these in your room, didn't you?

dialogue.name: MERCHANT03038
dialogue.text: I did. Do you mean to say I'm supposed to sleep on that?

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Allow me to demonstrate.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: That's it! Put it down over here!

dialogue.name: BORDERGUARDCORPS03038
dialogue.text: Yes, Captain!

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Sssee?

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: This is how we Ananta go to sssleep─ We just coil up like this and we're perfectly comfortable.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: You scaly-pated imbecile! Do you think we can “just coil up” like that? Get up, would you?

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: <sigh> Fine...

dialogue.name: BORDERGUARDCORPS03038
dialogue.text: We'll help you, Captain Alpa!

dialogue.name: MERCHANT03038
dialogue.text: And on that note, I bid you all farewell.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: It's partly my fault, I suppose. I should've made sure that Alpa knew what a guest room actually is first.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: To be honest, it's been a while since I stayed in a decent inn myself, so I'm probably not in any position to give proper advice. Any thoughts?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We could head to a village with one and ask around?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing builds character like a cold, hard floor, I say.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: I doubt our guestsss will be in the mood for any character-building after a long journey. Any other ideas?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, there are several inns for travelers in Ala Ghiri.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Good idea. We might find sssomeone who can come here to tell us what this place is misssing.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Let's head to the inns in Ala Ghiri.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: I think I sssaw that merchant a few moments ago. He can't have gone far.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: You think we should ask him? No, not a good idea. Merchants tend to be a bit wary of us military types.

dialogue.name: WEIDHERI
dialogue.text: Advice on accommodation? Sorry, I'm needed here for the time being. Might be worth asking around though.

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: You want me to go all the way to Castellum Velodyna? I'd love to help, but I've got my hands full here as it is.

dialogue.name: GERBOD
dialogue.text: Lodgings, you say? You ought to try askin' people who used to work in Goodblade. 'Course, it's naught more than rubble now, so the old residents are lookin' to apply their trades elsewhere.

dialogue.name: GERBOD
dialogue.text: A bloke called Gales used to run an inn there and he took pride in his work. You should find him still mopin' around there.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: How goes the sssearch? I'm not having much luck.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: It turns out that everyone's busy trying to get Ala Ghiri back on its feet. They might have some useful information, though. Let's keep trying.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: They can't all be busy, can they?

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Did you find anyone?

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: A man named Gales? And he was an innkeeper? Perfect! Let's go and look for him!

dialogue.name: WEIDHERI
dialogue.text: Actually, I could use a hand here if you're free!

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: Sorry I couldn't be more helpful.

dialogue.name: GERBOD
dialogue.text: If you're heading over to Goodblade, watch your backs. There's all sorts of horrible things lurkin' about.

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: What brings you to Goodblade? Or rather, what's left of it...

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: Oh, I see. You say my advice may prove beneficial? It's very kind of you to ask, but I should warn you─failure seems to follow me everywhere I go...

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: He's a ray of sunshine, isn't he?

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: Since the fall of Goodblade, I've tried working elsewhere. It never seems to last long because everyone takes such a disliking to me. I can't say I blame them. I'm no good to anyone.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: But we heard you were a first-rate innkeeper! You should put that experience to good use by helping usss!

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: <sigh> If you say so. I'm just worried that I'll go all the way to the castellum only for you to change your minds and turn me away. It would be just my luck...

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: We wouldn't do that. We need you! Let's head for the cassstellum. I'll explain more on the way.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Is that Gales?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Hopefully he'll be just what we're looking for!

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: Oi! You scrawny little turd! Are these supposed to be guest rooms!? It's an insult!

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Is sssomething amiss, Gales?

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: You're bloody right something's amiss! Why would anyone torture themselves by sleeping in this shitehole? That bed's not fit for a chocobo! And that's another thing─ Where are the chocobos meant to stay?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: So this is why he has trouble keeping a job...

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: All right, Gales, I hear you loud and clear! I'll do whatever it takes to turn this place around!

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: You know bugger all about how to treat guests, but you've got the right attitude! Let's get to work!

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: Like I was saying, there's nothing for chocobos at all, so we'll start with that. We need a stable and troughs for food and water. Oi! You over there! Is there any wood or metal we can use?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Not really, no. I know a few places we might be able to get some, though.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: I'll arrange to have some timber collected. Forename, there should be some piles of scrap metal over at Castellum Corvi.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Don't worry─I'm not expecting you to lug it back here by yourself. The other Gatekeepers can take care of that. I just need you to prepare it for transport.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: We should have a marid crush it underfoot to break it into smaller pieces. If you speak with Dakshina, she should be able to get one ready. She's just outside the gate.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Gales is looking things over as we ssspeak. I was about to ask his opinion, but he seems a bit...different from before.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: It's hard to picture anyone being satisfied with Alpa's lodgings, never mind a professional.

dialogue.name: DAKSHINA
dialogue.text: We Ananta have lived alongssside marids for generations. Do not fear. Their enormousss size belies their gentle nature.

dialogue.name: DAKSHINA
dialogue.text: You wish to ride the marid? For what purpossse?

dialogue.name: DAKSHINA
dialogue.text: I sssee...crushing a few sssteel plates should pose no difficulty for a marid. They are even ssstronger than they look.

dialogue.name: DAKSHINA
dialogue.text: Should you be ssseparated from the marid, it will return to me of its own volition. Once the work is complete, you may disssmount as you please.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Even a tamed marid can be dangerous if startled, so don't make any sudden moves or loud noises!

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Once we're finished, you'll hardly recognize the place!

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: Now I'm really fired up!

dialogue.name: GUARDSOLDIER03038
dialogue.text: What strength! I wouldn't want to get on a marid's bad side, that's for sure.

dialogue.name: GUARDSOLDIERTTWO03038
dialogue.text: We'll carry the scrap back to Castellum Velodyna. You can go ahead and wait with Gales and the others.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This scrap metal must be broken into smaller pieces before it can be carried away. Ride the marid and use its Trample ability to prepare the raw materials for transport.

dialogue.name: DAKSHINA
dialogue.text: Do you wish to ride the marid again?

dialogue.name: GUARDSOLDIER03038
dialogue.text: J'olhmyn's explained the situation. We'll stay out of your way, so go ahead!

dialogue.name: GUARDSOLDIERTWO03038
dialogue.text: You get started. We'll deal with the scrap once you're done!

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: You're back! Where's the scrap?

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: It'll be here soon? I can't wait! I'll make the best chocobo stables you've ever bloody seen!

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: But first, I'll get Alpa to make some beds! And if she buggers it up, I'll have her guts for garters!

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: So, what do you think? Not bad, eh?

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: I made all the sheets myself too! Weaving is another ssspecialty of the Ananta, you know. Compared to the headdresses and clothing we usually make, this was sssimple!

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: To be honest, there's no point having a ssskill if you don't know what to do with it. That's why I'm glad Gales is here. I'd be lossst without his advice!

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: But I'm equally clueless when it comes to the Ananta! I've lived in Gyr Abania my whole life and I know next to nothing about them!

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: We may have our differences, but we share a common tongue. We can learn a lot from each other.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Yesss, I think so too.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: You've really made a difference here, Forename. I'm sure I'll need your help when more people start passing through our gates.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: That reminds me─ I should try out one of the new beds!

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: When I first met Alpa and heard she was captain of the Velodyna Gatekeepers, I didn't know what to expect. It was worth the journey though.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: (I'm glad he's calmed down a bit...)

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Ah! I guess it's not as sturdy as it looks...

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: <sigh> I just hope her mother doesn't show up now...

dialogue.name: GALES
dialogue.text: After what happened to Goodblade, I thought I was finished. Alpa asking me to come here could be the fresh start I've been looking for.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Guest rooms have been added to Castellum Velodyna.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have achieved Respected reputation with the Vira.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: New Vira tribal daily quests are now available from Eshana at Castellum Velodyna.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, you will be able to undertake three additional quests from Eshana as a reputation bonus. This bonus is available until the daily reset time for tribal quests.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These additional quests will become available after accepting all current daily quests from Eshana. Please be advised that you cannot undertake these quests if you have no remaining allowances.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to a wider selection of wares from Madhura.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: I think you'll be pleasantly sssurprised!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Hopefully the wood I brought was up to snuff.

dialogue.name: GUARDSOLDIER03038
dialogue.text: I always knew marids were strong but I've never seen anything like that before!

dialogue.name: GUARDSOLDIERTWO03038
dialogue.text: Let us handle this. I think Gales and the others could use your help.
